title: Karen Sandler (author)
text:
Karen Sandler (born in <a href="Gardena%2C%20California">Gardena, California</a>) is an American <a href="author">author</a> of <a href="Romance%20novel">romance</a>, <a href="young%20adult%20fiction">young adult</a>, <a href="science%20fiction">science fiction</a>, and <a href="Mystery%20fiction">mystery</a> novels.
Biography.
Karen Sandler was born in Gardena, California to a <a href="American%20Jews">Jewish</a> family, the daughter Samuel Stier and Barbara Joan (Russo) Stier, and raised nearby, in <a href="Hawthorne%2C%20California">Hawthorne</a>. After receiving a B.A. in mathematics with a minor in physics in 1976 from <a href="California%20State%20University%2C%20Dominguez%20Hills">California State University, Dominguez Hills</a>, Sandler worked as a software engineer at <a href="Rockwell%20International">Rockwell International</a> in <a href="Downey%2C%20California">Downey, California</a> on the <a href="Space%20Shuttle%20program">Space Shuttle project</a>. In 1978 she became a member of the technical staff at <a href="Hughes%20Aircraft%20Company">Hughes Aircraft Company</a>, working with communications satellites. In 1979, she completed her M.S. in computer science at <a href="UCLA">UCLA</a>. She married her husband, Gary Sandler, in 1981, and later had two sons. The family moved from Southern to Northern California in 1993, at which time Sandler became a stay-at-home mom.
While raising her two boys, Sandler wrote in her spare time, completing three romance novels before selling her first ("Just My Imagination") to <a href="Kensington%20Books">Kensington Books</a>. One of the pioneers of <a href="electronic%20publishing">electronic publishing</a>, Sandler saw her first <a href="electronic%20book">electronic book</a>, "Eternity", published by Hard Shell Word Factory in 1998. She's a member of <a href="Authors%20Guild">Authors Guild</a>, the <a href="Society%20of%20Children%27s%20Book%20Writers%20and%20Illustrators">Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators</a>.
